CVE-2024-30060
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-17T00:31:06

4 posts

Azure Monitor Agent Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-16T23:03:16.608Z ##

Microsoft out-of-band zero-day: CVE-2024-30060 - Security Update Guide
CVE-2024-30060 (7.8 high, disclosed 16 May 2024 by Microsoft) Azure Monitor Agent Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability with CWE-59: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
Is marked publicly disclosed, but Not Exploited, Exploitation LESS likely.

What privileges could be gained by an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability?
An authenticated attacker would be able to delete targeted files on a system which could result in them gaining SYSTEM privileges.

What actions do customers need to take to protect themselves from this vulnerability?
We released CVE-2024-30060 to help keep customers protected. Customers who have installed the latest updates, or have automatic updates enabled, are already protected. Customers who have disabled Automatic Extension Upgrades or would like to upgrade an extension immediately must manually update their Azure Monitor Agent to the latest version. For more information on how to perform a manual update, see Manage Azure Monitor Agent.

cc: @serghei @campuscodi @mttaggart @GossiTheDog

#CVE_2024_30060 #zeroday #vulnerability #Microsoft

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T23:03:16.000Z ##

Customers who have disabled Automatic Extension Upgrades or would like to upgrade an extension immediately must manually update their Azure Monitor Agent to the latest version. For more information on how to perform a manual update, see Manage Azure Monitor Agent.

CVE-2024-30051
(7.8 HIGH)

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-15T20:40:02.000Z ##

threatcodex at 2024-05-15T14:26:26.489Z ##

QakBot attacks with Windows zero-day (CVE-2024-30051)
#CVE_2024_30051 #Qakbot
https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T21:05:26.156Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA adds only the Microsoft exploited zero days CVE-2024-30051 and CVE-2024-30040 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #eitw #zeroday #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30051

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T21:03:30.579Z ##

@dreadpir8robots The five alarm fire is definitely CVE-2024-30051 for sure. Kaspersky states that they discovered an exploitation guide regarding a Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) vulnerability uploaded to VirusTotal. And while the described exploitation process is identical to CVE-2023-36033, the vulnerability was different (new): https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

We have seen it used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

In your blog post, I think it ought to be mentioned that CVE-2024-30046 is only considered a zero-day because it's marked Publicly Disclosed. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-30046

#CVE_2024_30051 #CVE_2024_30046 #PatchTuesday #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T17:23:03.524Z ##

Kaspersky writes a related blog post about one of the zero-days: QakBot attacks with Windows zero-day (CVE-2024-30051)
The blog post details how a document uploaded to VirusTotal on 01 April 2024 described an exploitation process for Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) identical to CVE-2023-36033 but with a different vulnerability. Kaspersky identified that an exploit was used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#CVE_2024_30051 #PatchTuesday #eitw #vulnerability #zeroday #activeexploitation #Microsoft #MSRC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T17:04:14.901Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft. 61 vulnerabilities, 3 zero days:

  • CVE-2024-30051 (7.8 high) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability publicly disclosed and exploited
  • CVE-2024-30040 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability exploited
  • CVE-2024-30046 (5.9 medium) Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability publicly disclosed

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#eitw #activeexploitation #Microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #MSRC #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30046 #CVE_2024_30051

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.626Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.000Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T18:55:32.000Z ##

Microsoft has released fixes for 59 CVE-numbered vulnerabilities, including two zero-days (CVE-2024-30051, CVE-2024-30040) actively exploited by attackers.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/14/patch-tuesday-cve-2024-30051-cve-2024-30040/

#Patch #cybersecurity #CVE

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T17:25:39.000Z ##

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-05-14T17:20:25.000Z ##

In April 2024, while researching CVE-2023-36033, we discovered another zero-day elevation-of-privilege vulnerability, which was assigned...

##

CVE-2024-4671
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.97%

updated 2024-05-16T20:27:10.670000

30 posts

Use after free in Visuals in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.201 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-15T08:45:03.000Z ##

Chrome Vulnerability Alert: Google’s Rapid Response to 6th Zero-Day Exploit https://thecyberexpress.com/new-google-chrome-vulnerability/ #criticalvulnerabilities #zerodayvulnerabilities #Chromevulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20244671 #CVE20244761 #ZeroDay

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-14T13:23:23.000Z ##

I feel the need to point out that with this update, Opera went to Chromium "124.0.6367.62"… yes you read that right ".62" which is a build long before both recent 0-day exploits (it is from last month).

To be clear, Opera is not faster at responding to the CVE-2024-4761 0-day than Edge or Brave (or Chrome and Vivaldi obviously), it is much, much slower. Unless they have backported security fixes and their Changelog gives no indication of that https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/changelog-for-110/ , they are missing all of the following security improvements

• High CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4558: Use after free in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4559: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
• High CVE-2024-4331: Use after free in Picture In Picture
• High CVE-2024-4368: Use after free in Dawn
• Critical CVE-2024-4058: Type Confusion in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4059: Out of bounds read in V8 API
• High CVE-2024-4060: Use after free in Dawn

#CVE_2024_4761 #CVE_2024_4671 #Chrome #OperaBrowser #OperaWebBrowser #ZeroDay

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-13T15:11:24.579Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
CISA adds CVE-2024-4671 (high severity) Use after free in Visuals to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

cc: @avoidthehack

#CVE_2024_4671 #KEV #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #Chrome #chromium

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-10T18:00:55.756Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published multiple Chromium related security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-4558 (high severity) Chromium: Use after free in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-4559 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
  • CVE-2024-30055 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-4671 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Visuals
    • "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4671 exists in the wild."

These advisories follow two Google Chrome blog posts from Tuesday and yesterday (see parent toot above). MSRC does not use the standard Microsoft security advisory to indicate that it's been exploited in the wild, but does keep the original Google statement that an exploit exists in the wild (actively exploited zero-day).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4558 #CVE_2024_4559 #CVE_2024_30055 #CVE_2024_4671 #eitw #zeroday #activeexploitation #chrome

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-10T11:20:08.170Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Wake up, new Google Chrome zero-day! CVE-2024-4671 (high severity) Use after free in Visuals

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4671 exists in the wild.

#zeroday #vulnerability #Chrome #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_4671

• High CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 [0-day exploit in the wild]

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published multiple Chromium related security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-4558 (high severity) Chromium: Use after free in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-4559 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
  • CVE-2024-30055 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-4671 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Visuals
    • "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4671 exists in the wild."

These advisories follow two Google Chrome blog posts from Tuesday and yesterday (see parent toot above). MSRC does not use the standard Microsoft security advisory to indicate that it's been exploited in the wild, but does keep the original Google statement that an exploit exists in the wild (actively exploited zero-day).

##
nathans at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.842Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-13T21:17:50.000Z ##

Fixes a new 0-day, CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_13.html

Not to be confused with CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_9.html

The CVE numbers look similar and the previous one was only just fixed before this.

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-13T21:17:36.000Z ##

This update (to Chrome and Vivaldi) is a fix for yet another Chromium zero day "CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8".

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_13.html

The previous update fixed "CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals"

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_9.html

The CVE numbers look similar and come just days apart but they are not the same.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-13T14:25:53.555Z ##

@avoidthehack

This looks Chrome specific, so not sure if it affects #Chromium forks.

CVE-2024-4671 does affect Chromium. Published 10 May 2024 (1 day later): https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-4671

"The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based)."

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-13T13:38:47.398Z ##

#Google fixes fifth #Chrome zero-day exploited in attacks this year

The latest patch fixes CVE-2024-4671, which is a use after free memory vulnerability which could result in a crash or code execution.

Update ASAP. NOT Chrome specific, vulnerability is found in #Chromium. Forks should be rolling out updates.

#browsers #cve #security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-fifth-chrome-zero-day-vulnerability-exploited-in-attacks-in-2024/

Tracked as CVE-2024-4671, the high-severity vulnerability has been described as a case of use-after-free in the Visuals component. It was reported by an anonymous researcher on May 7, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/chrome-zero-day-alert-update-your.html

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft. 61 vulnerabilities, 3 zero days:

  • CVE-2024-30051 (7.8 high) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability publicly disclosed and exploited
  • CVE-2024-30040 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability exploited
  • CVE-2024-30046 (5.9 medium) Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability publicly disclosed

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.626Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

##

##

CVE-2024-20326
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-16T15:44:44.683000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the ConfD CLI and the Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator CLI could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, local attacker to read and write arbitrary files as root on the underlying operating system. This vulnerability is due to improper authorization enforcement when specific CLI commands are used. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by executing an affec

screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T16:10:56.510Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (Wednesday) from Cisco:

  • CVE-2024-20394 (5.5 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Network Visibility Service Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20391 (6.8 medium) Cisco Secure Client for Windows with Network Access Manager Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20369 (4.7 medium) Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Open Redirect Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20366 (7.8 high)Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20256, CVE-2024-20257, CVE-2024-20258 (6.1 medium) Cisco Secure Email and Web Manager, Secure Email Gateway, and Secure Web Appliance Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20392 (6.1 medium) Cisco Secure Email Gateway HTTP Response Splitting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20326, CVE-2024-20389 (7.8 high) ConfD CLI Privilege Escalation and Arbitrary File Read and Write Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20326, CVE-2024-20389 (7.8 high) Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Vulnerabilities

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in [these] advisor[ies].

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T16:10:56.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-20391 (6.8 medium) Cisco Secure Client for Windows with Network Access Manager Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20369 (4.7 medium) Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Open Redirect Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20366 (7.8 high)Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20389
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-16T15:44:44.683000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the ConfD CLI and the Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator CLI could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, local attacker to read and write arbitrary files as root on the underlying operating system. This vulnerability is due to improper authorization enforcement when specific CLI commands are used. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by executing an affec

screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T16:10:56.510Z ##

CVE-2024-35302
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-16T13:03:05.353000

2 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11 stored XSS during restore from backup was possible

screaminggoat at 2024-05-16T18:12:49.317Z ##

Ya boy @screaminggoat staying on top of JetBrains--and their lack of security advisories. On 03 May 2024, JetBrains announced a new TeamCity version (see parent toot above). Today, those unidentified security fixes were assigned CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-35300 (CVSSv3: 3.5 low) In JetBrains TeamCity between 2024.03 and 2024.03.1 several stored XSS in the available updates page were possible
  • CVE-2024-35301 (5.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.1 commit status publisher didn't check project scope of the GitHub App token
  • CVE-2024-35302 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11 stored XSS during restore from backup was possible

cc: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_35300 #CVE_2024_35301 #CVE_2024_35302 #CVE #TeamCity

##

CVE-2024-4950(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T21:31:35

2 posts

Inappropriate implementation in Downloads in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.60 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Low)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T02:29:42.089Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) put out several Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

The vulnerabilities are in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable.

Moreover, according to the Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates:

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-4947 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 124.0.2478.109) and Extended Stable channel (Version 124.0.2478.109), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild.

See parent toot above for original source. cc: @ruario

#CVE_2024_4947 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #Chrome #Chromium #MSRC #Microsoft #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4948 #CVE_2024_4949 #CVE_2024_4950

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-17T02:29:42.000Z ##

updated 2024-05-15T21:31:31

25 posts

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T23:29:24.580Z ##

Microsoft: Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates
Microsoft doesn't mention the CVE by name, but they're talking about CVE-2024-4947:

May 15, 2024 Microsoft is aware of the recent exploits existing in the wild. We are actively working on releasing a security fix.

cc: @ligniform

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #chrome #chromium #microsoft #CVE_2024_4947

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T21:31:36.912Z ##

Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Yo wtf. ANOTHER Google Chrome zero day. 9 vulnerabilities fixed, 4 externally reported. CVE-2024-4947 is a Type Confusion in V8 that was reported by Kaspersky researchers.

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.

h/t @ruario https://social.vivaldi.net/@ruario/112447192279329412
cc: @briankrebs @campuscodi @jwarminsky @serghei

#zeroday #eitw #CVE_2024_4947 #activeexploitation #chrome #google

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-15T21:19:47.000Z ##

• Vivaldi: 6.7.3329.31
• Chrome: 125.0.6422.60
• Chrome ESR: 124.0.6367.221

All of these include a security fix to resolve “CVE-2024-4947: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

[Vivaldi is not listed 🆕 in the proceeding post because we actually published earlier in the day. While the 0-day was not mentioned then, we did already have that fix from the time we first released the build]

#CVE_2024_4947 #Chrome #VivaldiBrowser #ZeroDay

##
nathans at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.842Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-16T17:44:03.595Z ##

Google fixes third actively exploited #Chrome zero-day in a week

Geez, #Google has pushed a #security fix for yet another zero-day exploited in the wild. Separate from the other two (tracked as CVE-2024-4947), it’s a type confusion weakness in the V8 JavaScript engine.

It affects all #Chromium based browsers. Forks (Vivaldi, Brave, Edge) should be rolling out updates. Again… so, as usual, update ASAP.

#browsers #infosec #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-16T09:40:05.000Z ##

##
mnordhoff at 2024-05-16T08:18:06.296Z ##

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_15.html

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.

What is this, 3 Chrome 0-days in like 2 weeks?

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T23:12:02.481Z ##

@ligniform I agree in part, disagree in part. The exploited vulnerabilities in V8 JavaScript engine have only been documented in Chromium based browsers like Edge, Opera, Vivaldi, Brave, etc.

LibwebP was a rare case last year that Google incorrectly limited the vulnerability's scope to only identify Google Chrome when in reality it impacted plenty of downstream libraries and apps.

Expect to see a Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory probably tomorrow for CVE-2024-4947.

##
ligniform at 2024-05-15T22:51:57.956Z ##

I'm guessing the 0-day CVE-2024-4947 is also present in Edge? Unless I'm a silly billy and don't understand this properly. It's Libwebp all over again

#InfoSec #Zeroday #0day #CyberSecurity

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-15T21:20:03.000Z ##

Includes a security fix to resolve “CVE-2024-4947: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

##
nathans@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.000Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T17:44:03.000Z ##

Google fixes third actively exploited #Chrome zero-day in a week

Geez, #Google has pushed a #security fix for yet another zero-day exploited in the wild. Separate from the other two (tracked as CVE-2024-4947), it’s a type confusion weakness in the V8 JavaScript engine.

It affects all #Chromium based browsers. Forks (Vivaldi, Brave, Edge) should be rolling out updates. Again… so, as usual, update ASAP.

#browsers #infosec #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
mnordhoff@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T08:18:06.000Z ##

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_15.html

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T23:12:02.000Z ##

@ligniform I agree in part, disagree in part. The exploited vulnerabilities in V8 JavaScript engine have only been documented in Chromium based browsers like Edge, Opera, Vivaldi, Brave, etc.

LibwebP was a rare case last year that Google incorrectly limited the vulnerability's scope to only identify Google Chrome when in reality it impacted plenty of downstream libraries and apps.

Expect to see a Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory probably tomorrow for CVE-2024-4947.

##
ligniform@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T22:51:57.000Z ##

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-15T21:20:03.000Z ##

Includes a security fix to resolve “CVE-2024-4947: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

##

CVE-2024-4949(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T21:31:31

2 posts

Use after free in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T02:29:42.089Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) put out several Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

The vulnerabilities are in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable.

Moreover, according to the Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates:

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-4947 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 124.0.2478.109) and Extended Stable channel (Version 124.0.2478.109), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild.

See parent toot above for original source. cc: @ruario

#CVE_2024_4947 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #Chrome #Chromium #MSRC #Microsoft #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4948 #CVE_2024_4949 #CVE_2024_4950

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-17T02:29:42.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) put out several Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

The vulnerabilities are in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable.

Moreover, according to the Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates:

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-4947 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 124.0.2478.109) and Extended Stable channel (Version 124.0.2478.109), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild.

See parent toot above for original source. cc: @ruario

##

CVE-2024-30055
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-15T21:31:25

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-10T18:00:55.756Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published multiple Chromium related security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-4558 (high severity) Chromium: Use after free in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-4559 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
  • CVE-2024-30055 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-4671 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Visuals
    • "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4671 exists in the wild."

These advisories follow two Google Chrome blog posts from Tuesday and yesterday (see parent toot above). MSRC does not use the standard Microsoft security advisory to indicate that it's been exploited in the wild, but does keep the original Google statement that an exploit exists in the wild (actively exploited zero-day).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4558 #CVE_2024_4559 #CVE_2024_30055 #CVE_2024_4671 #eitw #zeroday #activeexploitation #chrome

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-10T18:00:55.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published multiple Chromium related security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-4558 (high severity) Chromium: Use after free in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-4559 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
  • CVE-2024-30055 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-4671 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Visuals
    • "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4671 exists in the wild."

These advisories follow two Google Chrome blog posts from Tuesday and yesterday (see parent toot above). MSRC does not use the standard Microsoft security advisory to indicate that it's been exploited in the wild, but does keep the original Google statement that an exploit exists in the wild (actively exploited zero-day).

CVE-2024-20391
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T18:35:11.453000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the Network Access Manager (NAM) module of Cisco Secure Client could allow an unauthenticated attacker with physical access to an affected device to elevate privileges to SYSTEM. This vulnerability is due to a lack of authentication on a specific function. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges on an affected device.

  • CVE-2024-20392 (6.1 medium) Cisco Secure Email Gateway HTTP Response Splitting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20326, CVE-2024-20389 (7.8 high) ConfD CLI Privilege Escalation and Arbitrary File Read and Write Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20326, CVE-2024-20389 (7.8 high) Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Vulnerabilities

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in [these] advisor[ies].

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

updated 2024-05-15T18:35:11.453000

2 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco AppDynamics Network Visibility Agent could allow an unauthenticated, local attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to the inability to handle unexpected input. An attacker who has local device access could exploit this vulnerability by sending an HTTP request to the targeted service. A successful exploit cou

CVE-2024-3744
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T17:16:59

2 posts

A security issue was discovered in azure-file-csi-driver where an actor with access to the driver logs could observe service account tokens. These tokens could then potentially be exchanged with external cloud providers to access secrets stored in cloud vault solutions. Tokens are only logged when TokenRequests is configured in the CSIDriver object and the driver is set to run at log level 2 or gr

CVE-2024-31472
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T16:40:19.330000

2 posts

There are command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying Soft AP Daemon service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying oper

screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T14:46:55.715Z ##

HPE Aruba Networking security advisory: Aruba Access Points Multiple Vulnerabilities
HPE Aruba Networking has released patches for Aruba Access Points running InstantOS and ArubaOS 10 that address 18 security vulnerabilities. CVE-2024-31466, CVE-2024-31467, CVE-2024-31468, CVE-2024-31469, CVE-2024-31470, CVE-2024-31471, CVE-2024-31472, and CVE-2024-31473 are rated critical with a CVSSv3 score of 9.8. 31466-31470 are unauthenticated buffer overflow while 31471-31473 are unauthenticated command injection. The other vulnerabilities include unauth arbitrary file deletion, auth RCE, unauth DoS, and auth sensitive info disclosure. Keep in mind that some products are EoL and not patched.

HPE Aruba Networking is not aware of any public discussion or exploit code targeting these specific vulnerabilities as of the release date of the advisory.

#Aruba #PatchTuesday #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T14:46:55.000Z ##

updated 2024-05-14T21:37:55

2 posts

Ant Media Server Community Edition in a default configuration is vulnerable to an improper HTTP header based authorization, leading to a possible use of non-administrative API calls reserved only for authorized users.  All versions up to 2.9.0 (tested) and possibly newer ones are believed to be vulnerable as the vendor has not confirmed releasing a patch.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-13T11:27:54.150Z ##

CERT.PL third-party security advisory: Vulnerability in Ant Media Server software
Ant Media Server Community Edition in a default configuration is vulnerable to an improper HTTP header based authorization, leading to a possible use of non-administrative API calls reserved only for authorized users. The vulnerability has been assigned the CVE-2024-3462 identifier. All versions up to 2.9.0 (tested) and possibly newer ones are believed to be vulnerable as the vendor has not confirmed releasing a patch.

#CVE_2024_3462 #AntMedia #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-13T11:27:54.000Z ##

CERT.PL third-party security advisory: Vulnerability in Ant Media Server software
Ant Media Server Community Edition in a default configuration is vulnerable to an improper HTTP header based authorization, leading to a possible use of non-administrative API calls reserved only for authorized users. The vulnerability has been assigned the CVE-2024-3462 identifier. All versions up to 2.9.0 (tested) and possibly newer ones are believed to be vulnerable as the vendor has not confirmed releasing a patch.

#CVE_2024_3462 #AntMedia #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-4761
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

30 posts

Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.207 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

1 repos

https://github.com/michredteam/CVE-2024-4761

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-15T08:45:03.000Z ##

Chrome Vulnerability Alert: Google’s Rapid Response to 6th Zero-Day Exploit https://thecyberexpress.com/new-google-chrome-vulnerability/ #criticalvulnerabilities #zerodayvulnerabilities #Chromevulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20244671 #CVE20244761 #ZeroDay

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-16T14:39:50.886Z ##

Hot off the press! CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-4761 (pending score) Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Write Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-40655 (7.5 high) D-Link DIR-605 Router Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2014-100005 (CVSS*v2* 6.8 medium) D-Link DIR-600 Router Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability

Link is future-proofed so it should work when it becomes available

cc: @hrbrmstr @campuscodi

#eitw #zeroday #vulnerability #cve #activeexploitation #kev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #cisa #dlink #chrome #CVE_2024_4761 #CVE_2021_40655 #CVE_2014_100005

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T19:11:39.617Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): Chromium: CVE-2024-4761 Out of bounds write in V8
MSRC adds the Chromium security advisory 2 hours later as an afterthought. This actively exploited Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-4761 is in "Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable."

#CVE_2024_4761 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #Chrome

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-14T13:23:23.000Z ##

I feel the need to point out that with this update, Opera went to Chromium "124.0.6367.62"… yes you read that right ".62" which is a build long before both recent 0-day exploits (it is from last month).

To be clear, Opera is not faster at responding to the CVE-2024-4761 0-day than Edge or Brave (or Chrome and Vivaldi obviously), it is much, much slower. Unless they have backported security fixes and their Changelog gives no indication of that https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/changelog-for-110/ , they are missing all of the following security improvements

• High CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4558: Use after free in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4559: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
• High CVE-2024-4331: Use after free in Picture In Picture
• High CVE-2024-4368: Use after free in Dawn
• Critical CVE-2024-4058: Type Confusion in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4059: Out of bounds read in V8 API
• High CVE-2024-4060: Use after free in Dawn

#CVE_2024_4761 #CVE_2024_4671 #Chrome #OperaBrowser #OperaWebBrowser #ZeroDay

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T10:19:41.550Z ##

Wake up, another Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
CVE-2024-4761 (high severity) Out of bounds write in V8

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4761 exists in the wild.

h/t: @ruario cc: @campuscodi @todb

##
nathans at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.842Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

- Siemens Simcenter Nastran https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-137-05
- Siemens Polarion ALM https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-137-04
- Siemens Teamcenter Visualization and JT2Go https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-137-03
- Siemens SICAM Products https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-137-02

- CVE-2021-40655 D-Link DIR-605 Router Information Disclosure Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-40655

- CVE-2024-4761 #Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Write Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4761

avoidthehack at 2024-05-14T18:30:01.560Z ##

#Google Chrome emergency #update fixes 6th zero-day exploited in 2024

Google has released another #security update tracked as CVE-2024-4761 - out of bounds memory write in the JavaScript V8 engine. Under active exploitation in the wild.

This is a different vulnerability than the use after free they just fixed a few days ago.

This affects all #Chromium based browsers (ex: Edge, Brave, Vivaldi). Forks should be rolling out updates ASAP.

Update ASAP.

@screaminggoat

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

There are no currently oustanding 0-days in stable versions that we are aware of.

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-14T12:41:49.141Z ##

The new zero-day, tracked as CVE-2024-4761, has been described as a high-severity out-of-bounds write issue in the V8 JavaScript and WebAssembly engine. https://www.securityweek.com/google-patches-second-chrome-zero-day-in-one-week/

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-13T21:17:50.000Z ##

Fixes a new 0-day, CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_13.html

Not to be confused with CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_9.html

The CVE numbers look similar and the previous one was only just fixed before this.

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-13T21:17:36.000Z ##

This update (to Chrome and Vivaldi) is a fix for yet another Chromium zero day "CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8".

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_13.html

The previous update fixed "CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals"

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_9.html

The CVE numbers look similar and come just days apart but they are not the same.

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

CVE-2024-4367
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

4 posts

A type check was missing when handling fonts in PDF.js, which would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the PDF.js context. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

postmodern at 2024-05-12T19:40:01.266Z ##

https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wgrm-67xf-hhpq
PDF.js has isEvalSupported enabled by default.🤦

##

CVE-2024-32002
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

6 posts

Git is a revision control system. Prior to versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4, repositories with submodules can be crafted in a way that exploits a bug in Git whereby it can be fooled into writing files not into the submodule's worktree but into a `.git/` directory. This allows writing a hook that will be executed while the clone operation is still running, giving

1 repos

https://github.com/Disseminator/CVE-2024-32002

parvXtl@tech.lgbt at 2024-05-15T19:35:06.000Z ##

#CVE2024_32002 Detail [re #Git #submodule bug that had allowed to create files outside in ".git/"]
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32002
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-32002

Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution,
https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-8h77-4q3w-gfgv

submodules: submodule paths must not contain symlinks,
https://github.com/git/git/commit/97065761333fd62db1912d81b489db938d8c991d

#softwareDev #versionControlSoftware

##
alienghic@octodon.social at 2024-05-16T20:10:33.000Z ##

Bug in #Debian for tracking the recent #git vulnerabilities, which links to the specific Debian #CVE security tracker records.

Currently "vulnerable" hopefully there'll be some progress soon.

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1071160

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-32002
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-32004
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-32020
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-32021
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-32465

#CVE202432004
#CVE202432020
#CVE202432021
#CVE202432465

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-16T11:50:06.000Z ##

Critical Git vulnerability allows RCE when cloning repositories with submodules (CVE-2024-32002) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/16/git-cve-2024-32002/ #securityupdate #vulnerability #opensource #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #DevOps #GitHub #News #Git

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.519Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

#CVE #Git #vulnerability

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-16T11:50:06.000Z ##

Critical Git vulnerability allows RCE when cloning repositories with submodules (CVE-2024-32002) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/16/git-cve-2024-32002/ #securityupdate #vulnerability #opensource #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #DevOps #GitHub #News #Git

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

#CVE #Git #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-30046
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

8 posts

Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T21:03:30.579Z ##

@dreadpir8robots The five alarm fire is definitely CVE-2024-30051 for sure. Kaspersky states that they discovered an exploitation guide regarding a Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) vulnerability uploaded to VirusTotal. And while the described exploitation process is identical to CVE-2023-36033, the vulnerability was different (new): https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

We have seen it used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

In your blog post, I think it ought to be mentioned that CVE-2024-30046 is only considered a zero-day because it's marked Publicly Disclosed. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-30046

#CVE_2024_30051 #CVE_2024_30046 #PatchTuesday #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T17:04:14.901Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft. 61 vulnerabilities, 3 zero days:

  • CVE-2024-30051 (7.8 high) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability publicly disclosed and exploited
  • CVE-2024-30040 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability exploited
  • CVE-2024-30046 (5.9 medium) Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability publicly disclosed

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#eitw #activeexploitation #Microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #MSRC #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30046 #CVE_2024_30051

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T21:03:30.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots The five alarm fire is definitely CVE-2024-30051 for sure. Kaspersky states that they discovered an exploitation guide regarding a Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) vulnerability uploaded to VirusTotal. And while the described exploitation process is identical to CVE-2023-36033, the vulnerability was different (new): https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

We have seen it used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

In your blog post, I think it ought to be mentioned that CVE-2024-30046 is only considered a zero-day because it's marked Publicly Disclosed. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-30046

#CVE_2024_30051 #CVE_2024_30046 #PatchTuesday #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T17:04:14.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft. 61 vulnerabilities, 3 zero days:

  • CVE-2024-30051 (7.8 high) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability publicly disclosed and exploited
  • CVE-2024-30040 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability exploited
  • CVE-2024-30046 (5.9 medium) Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability publicly disclosed

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#eitw #activeexploitation #Microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #MSRC #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30046 #CVE_2024_30051

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T20:53:27.138Z ##

@avoidthehack It should be noted that only 2 are actively exploited. CVE-2024-30046, the Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability, is only publicly disclosed and marked Not Exploited: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30046

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.626Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T20:53:27.000Z ##

@avoidthehack It should be noted that only 2 are actively exploited. CVE-2024-30046, the Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability, is only publicly disclosed and marked Not Exploited: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30046

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.000Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

CVE-2024-31488
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

2 posts

An improper neutralization of inputs during web page generation vulnerability [CWE-79] in FortiNAC version 9.4.0 through 9.4.4, 9.2.0 through 9.2.8, 9.1.0 through 9.1.10, 8.8.0 through 8.8.11, 8.7.0 through 8.7.6, 7.2.0 through 7.2.3 may allow a remote authenticated attacker to perform stored and reflected cross site scripting (XSS) attack via crafted HTTP requests.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.238Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer
  • FG-IR-24-120 HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)
  • FG-IR-24-017 CVE-2024-26007 (5.3 medium) Node.js crash over administrative interface
  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

#Fortinet #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #FortiOS #HTTP2 #ContinuationFlood

CVE-2023-50180
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features

    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

#Fortinet #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #FortiOS #HTTP2 #ContinuationFlood

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command

  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox

  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities

##

CVE-2023-46714
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:14

2 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow [CWE-121] vulnerability in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.1 through 7.2.6 and version 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 allows a privileged attacker over the administrative interface to execute arbitrary code or commands via crafted HTTP or HTTPs requests.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.238Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox

  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)

    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)

2 posts

An improper check or handling of exceptional conditions vulnerability [CWE-703] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.4.1 allows an unauthenticated attacker to provoke a denial of service on the administrative interface via crafted HTTP requests.

##

CVE-2024-22270
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:04

6 posts

VMware Workstation and Fusion contain an information disclosure vulnerability in the Host Guest File Sharing (HGFS) functionality. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may be able to read privileged information contained in hypervisor memory from a virtual machine.

harrysintonen at 2024-05-16T09:16:20.047Z ##

Update your #VMwareFusion and #VMwareWorkstation ASAP: Multiple vulnerabilities in the bluetooth support allow malicious VM guests to gain code execution on the host system and/or read the hypervisor memory. https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/24280 #VMware #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #CVE_2024_22267 #CVE_2024_22268 #CVE_2024_22269 #CVE_2024_22270

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T14:05:58.795Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMware Workstation and Fusion updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22267, CVE-2024-22268, CVE-2024-22269, CVE-2024-22270)

  • CVE-2024-22267 (9.3 critical) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth use-after-free vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22268 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion Shader heap buffer-overflow vulnerability ()
  • CVE-2024-22269 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth information disclosure vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22270 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion HGFS information disclosure vulnerability

#PatchTuesday off to a rough start. No mention of exploitation but it's worth noting that these were demonstrated at Pwn2Own Security Contest 2024. See related Security Week reporting: VMware Patches Vulnerabilities Exploited at Pwn2Own 2024

#vulnerability #Vmware #CVE_2024_22267 #CVE_2024_22268 #CVE_2024_22269 #CVE_2024_22270

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T09:16:20.000Z ##

Update your #VMwareFusion and #VMwareWorkstation ASAP: Multiple vulnerabilities in the bluetooth support allow malicious VM guests to gain code execution on the host system and/or read the hypervisor memory. https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/24280 #VMware #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #CVE_2024_22267 #CVE_2024_22268 #CVE_2024_22269 #CVE_2024_22270

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T14:05:58.000Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMware Workstation and Fusion updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22267, CVE-2024-22268, CVE-2024-22269, CVE-2024-22270)

  • CVE-2024-22267 (9.3 critical) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth use-after-free vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22268 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion Shader heap buffer-overflow vulnerability ()
  • CVE-2024-22269 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth information disclosure vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22270 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion HGFS information disclosure vulnerability

#PatchTuesday off to a rough start. No mention of exploitation but it's worth noting that these were demonstrated at Pwn2Own Security Contest 2024. See related Security Week reporting: VMware Patches Vulnerabilities Exploited at Pwn2Own 2024

AAKL at 2024-05-14T15:21:58.457Z ##

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T15:21:58.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-22268
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:01

6 posts

VMware Workstation and Fusion contain a heap buffer-overflow vulnerability in the Shader functionality. A malicious actor with non-administrative access to a virtual machine with 3D graphics enabled may be able to exploit this vulnerability to create a denial of service condition.

harrysintonen at 2024-05-16T09:16:20.047Z ##

Update your #VMwareFusion and #VMwareWorkstation ASAP: Multiple vulnerabilities in the bluetooth support allow malicious VM guests to gain code execution on the host system and/or read the hypervisor memory. https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/24280 #VMware #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #CVE_2024_22267 #CVE_2024_22268 #CVE_2024_22269 #CVE_2024_22270

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T14:05:58.795Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMware Workstation and Fusion updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22267, CVE-2024-22268, CVE-2024-22269, CVE-2024-22270)

  • CVE-2024-22267 (9.3 critical) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth use-after-free vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22268 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion Shader heap buffer-overflow vulnerability ()
  • CVE-2024-22269 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth information disclosure vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22270 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion HGFS information disclosure vulnerability

#PatchTuesday off to a rough start. No mention of exploitation but it's worth noting that these were demonstrated at Pwn2Own Security Contest 2024. See related Security Week reporting: VMware Patches Vulnerabilities Exploited at Pwn2Own 2024

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:01

6 posts

##

CVE-2024-29212
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T16:13:02.773000

11 posts

Due to an unsafe de-serialization method used by the Veeam Service Provider Console(VSPC) server in communication between the management agent and its components, under certain conditions, it is possible to perform Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the VSPC server machine.

Newk at 2024-05-13T08:42:40.463Z ##

Critical #RCE #Vuln in #Veeam Service Provider Console

https://www.veeam.com/kb4575

#cve #vulnerability #CVE-2024-29212 #CVE202429212

##
Newk@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-13T08:42:40.000Z ##

Critical #RCE #Vuln in #Veeam Service Provider Console

https://www.veeam.com/kb4575

#cve #vulnerability #CVE-2024-29212 #CVE202429212

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-08T13:45:28.038Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Veeam Service Provider Console Vulnerability ( CVE-2024-29212 )
CVE-2024-29212 (8.8 high) Under certain conditions, an unsafe deserialization method in Veeam Service Provider Console (VSPC) server allows for remote code execution. Fixed in 7.0.0.18899 and 8.0.0.19236. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_29212 #Veeam #VSPC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

CVE-2024-27834
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T16:13:02.773000

4 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, Safari 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-13T23:04:11.328Z ##

Apple security advisory: About the security content of Safari 17.5
Apple has a habit of putting out a late advisory hours after the publications already covered the first ones. CVE-2024-27834 (An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication) was reported by Manfred Paul working with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative. No mention of exploitation.

cc: @wdormann

#Apple #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_27834

CVE-2024-23473
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-14T16:13:02.773000

2 posts

The SolarWinds Access Rights Manager was found to contain a hard-coded credential authentication bypass vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability allows access to the RabbitMQ management console. We thank Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative (ZDI) for its ongoing partnership in coordinating with SolarWinds on responsible disclosure of this and other potential vulnerabilities.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-13T13:25:58.590Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: ARM 2023.2.4 release notes
Two vulnerabilities in SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM), no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-28075 (9.0 critical) SolarWinds ARM Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-23473 (8.6 high) SolarWinds ARM Hard-Coded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_28075 #CVE_2024_23473 #SolarWinds #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-13T13:25:58.000Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: ARM 2023.2.4 release notes
Two vulnerabilities in SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM), no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-28075 (9.0 critical) SolarWinds ARM Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-23473 (8.6 high) SolarWinds ARM Hard-Coded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_28075 #CVE_2024_23473 #SolarWinds #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-28075
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T16:13:02.773000

2 posts

The SolarWinds Access Rights Manager was susceptible to Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows an authenticated user to abuse SolarWinds service resulting in remote code execution. We thank Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative (ZDI) for its ongoing partnership in coordinating with SolarWinds on responsible disclosure of this and other potential vulnerabilities.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-13T13:25:58.590Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: ARM 2023.2.4 release notes
Two vulnerabilities in SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM), no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-28075 (9.0 critical) SolarWinds ARM Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-23473 (8.6 high) SolarWinds ARM Hard-Coded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_28075 #CVE_2024_23473 #SolarWinds #vulnerability

CVE-2024-27804
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T16:13:02.773000

2 posts

The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

1 repos

https://github.com/R00tkitSMM/CVE-2024-27804

Cyberkid1987@defcon.social at 2024-05-14T19:01:57.000Z ##

❗Attention!

🕷️ Critical Vulnerability Alert: CVE-2024-27804

A high-severity vulnerability has been identified affecting multiple Apple operating systems, including iOS 17.5, iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, and macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app could potentially execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges due to an issue with memory handling.

🛡️ Risk Information:
- CVSS v2 Base Score: 9.3 (High)
- CVSS v3 Base Score: 7.8 (High)

📅 Published: 2024-05-14

Ensure your systems are updated to the latest versions to mitigate this vulnerability. Stay safe and vigilant!

📄Poc:
https://r00tkitsmm.github.io/fuzzing/2024/05/14/anotherappleavd.html

👤t.me/VasileiadisAnastasis
👥t.me/infosec101
👥t.me/infosec101center

##
Cyberkid1987@defcon.social at 2024-05-14T19:01:57.000Z ##

❗Attention!

🕷️ Critical Vulnerability Alert: CVE-2024-27804

A high-severity vulnerability has been identified affecting multiple Apple operating systems, including iOS 17.5, iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, and macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app could potentially execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges due to an issue with memory handling.

🛡️ Risk Information:
- CVSS v2 Base Score: 9.3 (High)
- CVSS v3 Base Score: 7.8 (High)

📅 Published: 2024-05-14

Ensure your systems are updated to the latest versions to mitigate this vulnerability. Stay safe and vigilant!

CVE-2024-34351
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-05-14T16:12:23.490000

2 posts

Next.js is a React framework that can provide building blocks to create web applications. A Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability was identified in Next.js Server Actions. If the `Host` header is modified, and the below conditions are also met, an attacker may be able to make requests that appear to be originating from the Next.js application server itself. The required conditions are 1

1 repos

https://github.com/Voorivex/CVE-2024-34351

screaminggoat at 2024-05-10T18:40:40.937Z ##

AssetNote: Digging for SSRF in NextJS apps
AssetNote blogs about NextJS, a content management system (CMS), which creates static content but has a lot of server side features enabled by default. They detail some common misconfigurations they find in NextJS websites, along with a vulnerability CVE-2024-34351 (7.5 high) Server-Side Request Forgery in Server Actions. They include a proof of concept.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_34351 #ProofofConcept #NextJS

CVE-2024-27852(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T15:33:09

4 posts

A privacy issue was addressed with improved client ID handling for alternative app marketplaces. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5. A maliciously crafted webpage may be able to distribute a script that tracks users on other webpages.

zeljkazorz at 2024-05-14T14:12:55.294Z ##

Apple has backported the patch for CVE-2024-23296 to the iOS 16 branch and has fixed a bug (CVE-2024-27852) in MarketplaceKit that may allow maliciously crafted webpages to distribute a script that tracks iOS users on other webpages.

The company has also added a new capability to iOS 17 that will alert users if an unknown Bluetooth tracker is “seen” moving with them.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/14/ios-bluetooth-tracker-alert/

@mysk #Apple #iOS #Privacy #Tracking

##
mysk@mastodon.social at 2024-05-13T19:13:45.000Z ##

CVE-2024-27852

#privacy #iOS #Apple #DMA #EU #infosecurity #InfoSec

https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214101

##

CVE-2008-0166
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 9.21%

updated 2024-05-14T01:50:09.780000

18 posts

OpenSSL 0.9.8c-1 up to versions before 0.9.8g-9 on Debian-based operating systems uses a random number generator that generates predictable numbers, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct brute force guessing attacks against cryptographic keys.

4 repos

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl

https://github.com/avarx/vulnkeys

https://github.com/demining/Vulnerable-to-Debian-OpenSSL-bug-CVE-2008-0166

https://github.com/g0tmi1k/debian-ssh

jbzfn@mastodon.social at 2024-05-15T10:15:00.000Z ##

🌀 16 years of CVE-2008-0166 - Debian OpenSSL Bug
— 16years.secvuln.info

"A patch in Debian's and Ubuntu's OpenSSL packages broke the random number generator, effectively limiting the number of possible keys to a few ten thousand plausible variations"

https://16years.secvuln.info/

#debian #openssl #CVE20080166 #infosec #linux #opensource

##
jbzfn@mastodon.social at 2024-05-15T10:15:00.000Z ##

##
briankrebs at 2024-05-12T14:07:04.752Z ##

Reason #2,391 why revisiting security assumptions is always a good idea.

[Bimi] No cryptographic connection between VMC and DKIM key

https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/bimi/Ba3jFfJ8K6ic7qg4DzPsIsGW5UY/

My favorite part:

"I guess some may consider what I just said as an unimportant or a merely theoretical issue, so I would like to illustrate it with an example. Let's take the domain entrust.com. It has a DKIM key
configured at "dkim._domainkey.entrust.com". The TXT record is the following:

"v=DKIM1; k=rsa;
p=MIGfMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBAQUAA4GNADCBiQKBgQCyGF0xzO7Eig1H8QdIErjEKOGnIVvoLU5VjcMRBRWZK65NinL+gVnjuMD2mYdjC3f+7sQCWxGDSKIFn/bB+iXxO2x1/ktkwXHQfQ/9FcFuy+LE0Snsm0SwXN/2l1m5f9e1xdswC+dzHt6DIpDSDENsRal019YKQTqwVyB++7QORwIDAQAB"

This is a 1024 bit RSA key, which is not up to modern standards. But breaking 1024 bit RSA is still only feasible for very powerful attackers. However, this key has another problem: it is vulnerable to
the Debian OpenSSL bug (CVE-2008-0166). It is trivially possible to
find the private key (you can use my tool badkeys -
https://badkeys.info/ - to do that):

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl/blob/main/rsa1024/ssl/le32/25731-rnd.key"

##

briankrebs@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-12T14:07:04.000Z ##

Reason #2,391 why revisiting security assumptions is always a good idea.

[Bimi] No cryptographic connection between VMC and DKIM key

https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/bimi/Ba3jFfJ8K6ic7qg4DzPsIsGW5UY/

My favorite part:

"I guess some may consider what I just said as an unimportant or a merely theoretical issue, so I would like to illustrate it with an example. Let's take the domain entrust.com. It has a DKIM key
configured at "dkim._domainkey.entrust.com". The TXT record is the following:

"v=DKIM1; k=rsa;
p=MIGfMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBAQUAA4GNADCBiQKBgQCyGF0xzO7Eig1H8QdIErjEKOGnIVvoLU5VjcMRBRWZK65NinL+gVnjuMD2mYdjC3f+7sQCWxGDSKIFn/bB+iXxO2x1/ktkwXHQfQ/9FcFuy+LE0Snsm0SwXN/2l1m5f9e1xdswC+dzHt6DIpDSDENsRal019YKQTqwVyB++7QORwIDAQAB"

This is a 1024 bit RSA key, which is not up to modern standards. But breaking 1024 bit RSA is still only feasible for very powerful attackers. However, this key has another problem: it is vulnerable to
the Debian OpenSSL bug (CVE-2008-0166). It is trivially possible to
find the private key (you can use my tool badkeys -
https://badkeys.info/ - to do that):

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl/blob/main/rsa1024/ssl/le32/25731-rnd.key"

updated 2024-05-13T09:30:26

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: netfilter: nf_tables: release mutex after nft_gc_seq_end from abort path The commit mutex should not be released during the critical section between nft_gc_seq_begin() and nft_gc_seq_end(), otherwise, async GC worker could collect expired objects and get the released commit lock within the same GC sequence. nf_tables_module_aut
